dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, are you kidding me? Sundays? I love Sundays. I live for Sundays. The whole family's together. Mom makes braciole. Dad puts the jersey on. We're all watching the game. Yeah, it drives me crazy, and yes, I was negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAT SOLATANO stands in the middle of his room, his back t camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't even know that I loved it, Nikki, but I did. I just didn't appreciate it, or you, before." There is a knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: MALE ORDERLY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on. Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost all that. I blew it. But you also blew it. We can get it back. We're gonna get it back. It's all gonna be better now. I'm better now and I hope you are, too. And I'm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another knock at the door. Pat ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'll be there in a minute, okay?

dialogues.speaker: MALE ORDERLY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Doctor's waiting. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there in a minute. Pat returns to his speech. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true love. See glimpses of Pat's room: mayonnaise jar filled with wa black trash bag strewn on the bed, handwritten sign taped Pat's wall, "EXCELSIOR".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: show he swallowed. PAT WALKS, SPITTING OUT THE PILL. PILL LANDS ON FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's when I had long hair. People say I talk about my hair too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it was just the way I wanted it, but he cut it back too far. He cut this side back too far trying to even it up. I didn't tell him to do that. I said, "Just cut it the way you cut it...."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you get in the right frame of mind, I think anything's possible. I think we get, we so often get caught in this state of negativity and it's a, it's a poison like nothing else. 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAT works out: drinks water from his plastic mayo jar, do squats, sit ups, push ups --

dialogues.speaker: RED TOE NAILS IN A WHITE FLAT SANDAL --
dialogues.text: Pat looks at the foot -- then looks up -- HIS MOTHER, DOLORES SOLATANO, dressed in a dress.

dialogues.speaker: DR. TIMBERS
dialogues.text: ...technically, you can take him out against our recommendation, but you assume a lot of liability in the eyes of the court. And he's just getting used to the routine here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want him to get used to the routine here. Eight months is already long enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mom. Can we give Danny a ride to North Philly? DOLORES STOPS THE CAR. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, no, it'll be fine. It'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess everybody's leaving today! Hello, Mrs. S. An honor to finally meet you. Pat told me all about you, how God made you rich in character, and you're the mighty oak that holds the household together, and not to mention the lasagna you make on game day when the Birds play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny was in for assault because of crystal meth and alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad combination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. On top of an anxiety disorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was when I was an X-ray technician with my ADD and my anxiety. I had a lot of access to medication and I took advantage of it. That's when my hair was long, too. But my hair only grew when I was older. When I was younger, my hair didn't grow because my brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember I told you about my brother, he had a Jheri curl, and I couldn't get a Jheri curl because my hair didn't grow long enough. I was so jealous of my brother... 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's obsessed with his hair. DOLORES'S CELL PHONE RINGS. SHE ANSWERS AS SHE DRIVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks great now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Yes, it is. PAT TOUCHES DANNY'S HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Pat touches hair) Wait, you're going the wrong way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) What? Are you sure about that? I'll bring him back right away. DOLORES HANGS UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to me, Pat. Danny's not allowed to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Mom, just hold on a sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just talk about this. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, just listen--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tou-...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...-ch the steering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...wheel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat, this whole thing was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mom. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am out on a limb for you with the courts right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my fault. Pat didn't know. Pat didn't know. He's my friend, so he was rootin' for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm havin' a disagreement with the hospital, but we're working it out. Take me back to the hospital, but take Pat home, he's fine. Trust me. You'll see, he's fine. It's my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, can we stop at the library? I wanna read Nikki's entire English high school syllabus. DELORES LOOKS AT HER SON, WORRIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, it's a good thing. I'm remaking myself.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (O.S. PRELAP)
dialogues.text: DeSean Jackson. What happened to DeSean Jackson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, tell me that one. PAT SR. It's insanity. He spikes the ball at the one yard line. The one- fucking-yard line. I mean, get into the end zone, dummy. I mean, he celebrates before he's even in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know something? It's nothing new. Your team does that all the time. They get close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then they blow it. They got an inferiority complex.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, what are you talking about? What makes the Cowboys America's Team?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we are, we're America's Team. PAT SR. You should be ashamed of yourself. We're in Philadelphia, what's the matter with you? You're a fucking traitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's more American than a cowboy? PAT SR. You know what's more American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? PAT SR. Benjamin Franklin, that's what's more American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin Franklin? PAT SR. Benjamin Franklin. The founder of our country, here in Philadelphia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the guy with the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...little glasses and the long scraggly hair? 10.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: What about the lightning with the kite? He stood in the storm with a kite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he wasn't on the hundred dollar bill, nobody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...would even know who he is. FALLEN FRAMED PHOTO OF PAT, ON THE TABLE BELOW. PAT SR. What are you doing? No, no, no, no. Don't touch them, don't touch them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't even touch `em. Why are you--, don't blame me. PAT SR. Who did this? Who took, who took, who took the...

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: -the remotes like this? Did you do this, Randy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't touch them. As a matter of fact, I don't know why you need so many. Hey, there she is! Look how beautiful! PAT SR. (turns, sees Pat) What?! What's this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. PAT SR. STEPS CLOSER, PATTING PAT ON THE ARM. PAT SR. Everything good? 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward, unsure) Mm-hmm. PAT SR. Ahh. PAT SR. EMBRACES PAT.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where is it? PAT SR. TOUCHES PAT'S SHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right here. PAT SR. You got it. Ahh, well, we got that. We don't want them to steal that. PAT SR. PULLS A GOLD NECKLACE OUT OF PAT'S SHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still got yours? PAT SR. Yeah, I got mine. PAT SR. LOOKS AT DOLORES.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what, you don't talk to me? You didn't tell me you took him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's ready. Look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell Dad you were picking me up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about that. PAT SR. I wanna make sure when you come out that you're okay, and she didn't say anything. (to Dolores) You didn't tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The court said yes. Don't worry. 12.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what did the doctor say? Because the, the court listens to the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and the court said-- PAT SR. The court listens to the doctor,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, relax. The court said it's fine, okay? Let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I'm in there because of the court. That's the agreement that we made months ago. It was a plea bargain with the courts. The lawyer, he instructed me, he said that what we should plead that, and then I would serve eight months and then I'd get out. PAT SR. Yeah, no, I just--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all under control. PAT SR. Well...okay, okay. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. So what are you doing with yourself? PAT SR. You know, I'm gonna start a restaurant. A DRAWING OF A RESTAURANT ON THE COFFEE TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's gonna be a cheesesteak place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you gonna pay for it? PAT SR. I'm gonna pay for it, don't worry about it. 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From your bookmaking? PAT SR. Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom told me. Outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not. No, I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just told me outside, Mom, what are you talking about? Five minutes ago, we were walking up the stairs, you said, "Don't say anything, but Dad lost his job and he's bookmaking." PAT SR. Why, Dolores? Why did you say that to him? He has the wrong idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine, Patrick. I'm more concerned about you than anything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, Dad. Good. PAT SR. Okay, the question, the big question, is what are you gonna do with yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I gonna do? I'm getting in shape, I'm getting trim, I'm getting really fit for Nikki. I'm gonna read Nikki's teaching syllabus and get my old job back. PAT SR. Nikki sold the house. She left. Didn't your mother tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something. You don't know anything about my marriage, okay, Dad? All right? Our marriage...we're very, very much in love, okay? Just like you two. PAT SR. Listen, Patrick, she's gone. She's not around anymore. Nikki left. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Dad? You know what? Excelsior. Excelsior. PAT SR. What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means you know what I'm gonna do, I'm gonna take all this negativity and use it as fuel and I'm gonna find a silver lining, that's what I'm gonna do. And that's no bullshit. That's no bullshit. That takes work and that's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?! CAMERA PULLS BACK AS PAT THROWS THE BOOK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid fucking book!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't believe Nikki's teaching that book to the kids. I mean the whole time -- let me just break it down for you -- the whole time you're rooting for this Hemingway guy to survive the war and to be with the woman that he loves, Catherine Barkley... HIS TIRED PARENTS LOOK AT HIM FROM THE BED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's four o'clock in the morning, Pat. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and he does. He does. He survives the war, after getting blown up he survives it, and he escapes to Switzerland with Catherine. But now Catherine's pregnant. Isn't that wonderful? She's pregnant. And they escape up into the mountains and they're gonna be happy, and they're gonna be drinking wine and they dance -- they both like to dance with each other, there's scenes of them dancing, which was boring, but I liked it, because they were happy. You think he ends it there? No! He writes another ending. She dies, Dad! I mean, the world's hard enough as it is, guys. It's fucking hard enough as it is. Can't somebody say, "Hey, let's be positive? Let's have a good ending to the story?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat, you owe us an apology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, for what, I can't apologize. I'm not gonna apologize for this. You know what I will do? I will apologize on behalf of Ernest Hemingway, because that's who's to blame here. PAT WALKS TO THE DOOR. PAT SR. Yeah, have Ernest Hemingway call us and apologize to us, too. PAT EXITS, CLOSING IT BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: Why didn't you run with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was reading. 17.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: Please. Do us a favor, don't read for a while.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you wearing a garbage bag for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go run now. PAT BEGINS TO JOG PAST PAT SR. PAT SR. Wait, wait, wait. You have to fix this window. PAT STOPS AND TURNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll fix it when I get back. PAT SR. Fix it now. DOLORES ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car, Pat. You have to go to therapy. DOLORES EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna go to therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to go. It's part of the deal. You can't live with us and not go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that song really playing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have music sometimes. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That song is killing me. Could you please turn it off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you can't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have the controls. I'm sorry, I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Doctor Timbers put you up to this? Is there a speaker here? PAT WALKS TO A MAGAZINE RACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is, is the speaker here? HE OVERTURNS THE METAL MAGAZINE RACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry. Okay...I'm sorry. I'll fix all this, okay? PAT PICKS UP THE MAGAZINES, EMOTIONAL, EMBARRASSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a messed up thing you did, Doctor Patel. That's a messed up thing. I'm sorry, but that's....

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: You can call me Cliff, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, Cliff, that's not the way you're supposed to meet people, okay? Why don't you write that down in your, I don't know, your little book you write stuff down in. 19.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about that song. I just wanted to see if it was still a trigger for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo. It's a trigger. I'm not gonna take any meds, I should just tell you that right now.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: You have to take medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not gonna take any medicine. It makes me foggy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you will have to take medication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want any meds, Doctor. Look, I am not the explosion guy, okay? My father is the explosion guy. I'm not that guy. He got kicked out of that stadium he beat up so many people at Eagles games, he's on the exclusion list. I had one incident.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: One incident can change a lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm ready. I'm ready to take responsibility for my side of the street. She just needs to take responsibility for hers.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: What's hers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's hers? Are you joking? Let's go back to the incident. I come home from work after I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left work early -- which I never do, by the way, but I got in a fight with Nancy, the high school

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...principal. I come home and what's playing but the song from my wedding. The song that you so charmingly played out here today for us. That's playing and I don't think anything of it. Which is odd, `cause I should have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come home, what do I see? I walk in the door and I see underwear and pieces of clothing and a guy's pants with his belt in it, and I walk up the stairs, and all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...ll of a sudden I see the DVD player, and on the D-...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...-VD player is the CD and it's playing our wedding song, and then I look down and I see my wife's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...panties on the ground and then-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I look up and I see her naked in the shower...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I think, "Oh, that's kinda sweet, she's in the shower. What a perfect thing. I'm gonna find her and maybe I'll go in there. We never-...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...fuck in the shower anymore. Maybe today we will." I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...pull the curtain back and there's the fucking history...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...-teacher with tenure. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know what he says to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You should probably go." That's what he says to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So yeah, I snapped. I almost beat him to death. But now I get fucking chastised for it? I'm parallel to my father? I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: All right. Can you talk about something that you did, before or after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, about a week before the incident, I called the cops and I told them that my wife and the history guy were plotting against me by embezzling money from the local high school, which wasn't true. It was a delusion. And we later found out from the hospital that's because I'm, uh...

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: ...undiagnosed bipolar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. With mood swings and weird thinking brought on by severe stress, which rarely happens, thank God. And then the shower incident happened and that's when everything snapped, so I then realized that, oh, wow, I've been dealing with this my whole life. And without any supervision I've been doing it all on my own with no help and basically I've been white-knuckling it this whole time. 23.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: That had to be hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's a lot to deal with, especially when you don't know what the hell is happening, which I do now. Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (O.S. PRELAP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat, you have to take your

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, Mom. I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will call them. They'll come for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you do that? You wouldn't do that. Why would you call them? PAT SR. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't, I don't feel good when I'm on them, Mom. I don't feel good. I'm so much clearer without them. Mom, they make me bloated. I don't like the way it makes me look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta take your medication. PAT SR. Why don't you just take your medication?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I'm doing it with my physicality. I've been workin' out, that's what I'm doin'. 24.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: Why is he wearing a garbage bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you wearing a garbage bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To sweat. PAT SR. Sit down. We're seven minutes in, no score. Come on, help turn the juju around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in juju, Dad. PAT SR. Come on, Mister Excelsior. You wanna be positive? Be positive. Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right. PAT SR. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a second. I'll watch the beginning of the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says you're good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..luck, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that in your hand? PAT SR. It's a... see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handkerchief? PAT SR. Yeah. PAT SR. STRAIGHTENS THE REMOTE CONTROLS. PAT SITS. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's OCD. That's crazy. PAT SR. What OCD? I want my son to watch the game with me, so sue me. PAT ENTERS R., STANDING UP.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just sit down, come on. I want you to watch the game with me. I'm not superstitious. That's a small thing that I do. If I make a lot of money, what's the difference if I do this or that? It's a small thing. Sit down. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making crabby snacks and homemades.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: You see?! You see that?! You're meant to be here! PAT LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is special. Everything happens for a reason. That's why you came home. Embrace it! Embrace it! THE TELEPHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the reason? I don't think so. PAT SR. ANSWERS THE TELEPHONE, HANDLING BETS. PAT SR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Tommy, Tommy, yes, yes. I got your whole sheet. Yeah. No, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom. PAT SR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm just confirming. I'm just confirming. Okay. THE DOORBELL RINGS. 26.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait, wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I do..an interview for a school project on mental illness? PAT SR. No. PAT SR. SLAMS THE DOOR CLOSED.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's for a school project! PAT SR. Don't pay any attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that? That's not Rick D'Angelo, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he the guy who's having the problem? PAT SR. People are stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's the one. PAT SR. They, they, they, they don't know what they're saying.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't let them hurt your feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you shut the door in his face. I'm going for a run. 27.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: No! (to kid Rick) Get outta here with that camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat, don't look for Nikki! PAT SR. Take your camera and get out of here! PAT JOGS, EXITING. RICK FOLLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Patrick, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat! PAT SR. Patty! Patty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look for Nikki!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Meckers! NANCY SEES PAT APPROACH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God! Oh, God! NANCY HURRIES to avoid him. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nance! This is my lucky day! Look at you working on a Sunday! NANCY HURRIES UP THE STAIRS TO A LOCKED SCHOOL ENTRANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you? Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came by to say hi, to let you know I'm ready to come back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll work full-time, half-time. I'll sub, I'll work history, whatever you want. PAT WALKS UP THE STAIRS TO NANCY, WHO UNLOCKS THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me give you a hand. I'm sorry. I'm being rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. PAT HELPS HER. NANCY OPENS THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something. Let me just ask you something. Does Nikki still work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can't tell you that. But Doug Culpepper is still here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you tell me that? You know he broke up my marriage. What, are you being, a troublemaker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you look good. Did you lose a lot of weight? 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did, yeah. I did. Thank you. PAT EMBRACES NANCY, WHO REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me! Get away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm better. I just want to let you know, I'm better now. Okay? I'm better. I feel good. I feel so good. Look at my eyes. Look at my eyes. Look at how clear they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a complainer anymore. I'm a positive guy. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just have to give it some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, a lot went down. People will get over it. It'll be all good. It'll work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! It will be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take that as a silver development, Nancy! A silver development! That's a silver lining!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie! Pat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is! He's back! THEY EMBRACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? You're out out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool, man. Wow, you lost a lot of weight. I almost didn't recognize you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I didn't visit you in the hospital. You know, work's out of control, you know, she had the baby. I'm really glad you're back. I missed you. I really need someone to talk to. You gotta come see the baby. She's beautiful. And Veronica wants to make dinner for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations on the baby, but I'm not buying the invitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause you think Veronica still hates you? 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Veronica still hates me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. Nikki always said that "Ronnie's wife keeps his social calendar where she keeps his balls, in her purse."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it's a little true. But if you think she still hates you, you're wrong because why would she tell me to invite you to dinner? Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you invite him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, can he make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know yet! (to Pat) Can you make it next Sunday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you next Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you guys are still in touch with Nikki, right? Does Veronica still talk to Nikki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in here, please. I need you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. VERONICA EXITS INTO THE HOUSE, CLOSING THE WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: As soon as you left, the Redskins threw a trick play, a pitch out to Randal El. Andy Reid wastes a time- out challenging it, loses the challenge, loses the game. You're in this house, please show some respect for what I do. And we should spend time together anyway. I'm trying to keep you out of trouble, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have very, good news, everybody. Very good news. PAT SR. What's that? What's the good news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are looking up. PAT SR. Oh, are they? PAT PICKS UP THE PHONE TO DIAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, I knew why they invited me over. I knew it. PAT SR. Listen, she might be with that guy. That, the....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no way! PAT SR. She--, no, she might be with him. She's afraid of you. She doesn't want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, Dad. You mean, Doug Culpepper? 33.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: Put the phone down. You gotta...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait just a minute. PAT SR REACHES FOR THE TELEPHONE. PAT SR. ...Put the phone down, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? THEY BOTH PULL ON THE TELEPHONE RECEIVER. PAT SR. Listen--, stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the phone. Dad, this is my life. Dad. PAT SR. Gimme the phone. Gimme the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat! PAT SR. You gotta understand me. You wanna go back? Well then, stop this! Then don't fucking do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk to me like that. PAT SR. Well then, don't behave this way. THEY REACT AS THE DOORBELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got...a call asking to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...check on this house. Pat Solatano? 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Missus Solatano, Mister Solatano, I'm Officer Keogh. I work this beat. Look, I heard about the restraining order. And I heard you went to your old house and the school. It's not okay. I've been assigned to your case, so you're gonna be seeing a lot of me. Do yourself a favor. Respect the restraining order, okay? Five hundred feet. PAT SR. You hear what he just said? You have a restraining order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Dad, I know. PAT SR. Thank you, Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need anything...my card. PAT SR. TAKES THE BUSINESS CARD. PAT SR. Thank you. Sorry. We understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when do cops have cards? PAT SR. CLOSES THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: Tell me one thing. Would you like to be a guy who goes back to jail or to the hospital? Hmm? So take your medication and if you do fine, we'll reduce them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki's waiting for me to get in shape and get my life in order, and then she's gonna be with me. And that's better than any medication. 35.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: Pat, there's a possibility, and I want you to be prepared for it, that she may not return. True love is about letting her go and seeing if she returns. In the meantime, if you listen to that song, I don't want you to fall apart. So get a strategy, okay? You need one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me say something, I gotta say something.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I believe to be true. This is what I learned in the hospital. You have to do everything you can, you have to work your hardest, and if you do, if you stay positive, you have a shot at a silver lining.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: Work on a strategy, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, my friend Ronnie's having this party on Sunday night and it's like a real hoity-toity thing and his wife, Veronica's a real stickler for.... I don't know, my mom got this Gap outfit she wants me to wear, but I wanna wear a jersey that my brother, Jake, got me from the Eagles.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: Which jersey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSean Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: DeSean Jackson is the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that settles that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat! What are you doin'? PAT STOPS AND TURNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stay, come on. I made a mistake, I shouldn't have worn this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you're fine. I like that jersey. I wish I was wearing that jersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you comfortable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veronica's not gonna like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus you got a tie on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it, you're the guest of honor. You come however you wanna come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get over here. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSean Jackson's in the house! CAMERA TILTS UP ONTO VERONICA, HOLDING THE BABY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean rookie of the year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSean Jackson? DeSean Jackson? (noticing Pat) Oh, you wore a jersey to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it awesome?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, he got us flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's sweet. (to Pat) That's sweet, Pat. That's lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out. We just redid the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! RONNIE LAUGHS. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tremendous. Tremendous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tremendous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man, I'm, I'm thinking of redoing it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta be making a lot of paper to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're doing all right, man. I can't complain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't the market down, though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is down, but you know, she wants more, so I'm giving her more, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you know my dad lost his pension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people. My uncle, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you know what? No disrespect, it's not personal, but this is the time to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You start snapping up commercial real estate -- cheap -- flip it over, you flip it over and that's when you make the money. But the pressure...it's like.... RONNIE GLANCES, LOOKING FOR VERONICA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not okay. Don't tell anybody. Listen to me. I feel like I'm getting crushed and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crushed by what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything. The family, the baby, the job, the fucking dicks at work, and it's like, you know, like I'm trying to do this, (Ronnie reaches for his throat, mimicking trying to breath) you know, and, and, and I'm like...suffocating. RONNIE COVERS HIS FACE WITH ONE HAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be happy all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you you can't be happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. You just do your best, you have no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie, Ronnie, Ronnie! THE DOORBELL RINGS. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're okay with Veronica's sister coming over. You okay with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veronica's sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiffany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiffany and...Tommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just Tiffany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Tommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't bring it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, how did he die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did who die?

dialogues.speaker: PAT LOOKS UP TO SEE VERONICA'S SISTER TIFFANY ENTER
dialogues.text: LOCK EYES IMMEDIATELY. SHE IS TALL, STRIKING, INTENSE. Sh walks to Ronnie and Pat, who is unsure how to behave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Tiffany! This is Pat. Pat, my sister-in-law Tiffany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look nice. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not flirting with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn't think you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just see that you made an effort and I'm gonna be better with my wife, I'm working on that. I wanna acknowledge her beauty. I never used to do that. I do that now. `Cause we're gonna be better than ever...Nikki. Just practicing. How'd Tommy die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got fired, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I'm sorry. How'd that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it really matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, how's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone having fun? We're gonna go on a tour now. We're gonna go on a tour now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go see the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's go for the tour. 42.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I've, I've been planning this forever. I love our house. I love our house. I'm really excited about it. Tiffany looks back over her shoulder at Pat, intensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motions to Pat) Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's a television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep going, keep going, keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a brick oven, it's a brick oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a light. It's a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, ooh, warmer, warmer, warmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it's a drawer at a morgue where they pull out dead bodies and shoot them with formaldehyde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think so hard, don't think so hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would the dead body...where would the body go, though? `Cause the outside of the-- 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a joke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a...fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the wall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a port in every room. Gimme an iPod. Who, who doesn't have an iPod?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't have an iPod. I don't even have a phone. They won't let me make any calls. They think I'm gonna call Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Don't focus on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would call Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm actually gonna give you one of my iPods. I have an old one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme your iPod. RONNIE HANDS AN IPOD TO VERONICA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me. Thank you, baby, thank you. VERONICA PLUGS THE IPOD INTO THE OUTLET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all the rooms there are iPod ports in, I'm happy you brought us into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, look, look. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can play music for the baby in any room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you play "Ride the Lightning" by Metallica? VERONICA IS SPEECHLESS. RONNIE GRINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat was a history sub at the high school, Tiffany. Ask him about any president, he knows 'em all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a fun fact. You know where the term "OK" comes from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Martin Van Buren, the eighth president of the United States of America, is from Kinderhook, New York...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and he was part of a club, a men's club, called Old Kinderhook. And if you were cool, you were in the club, they'd say, "That guy's OK." `Cause he was in the Old Kinderhooks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Pretty cool, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's interesting. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Tiffany's been doing this dance thing for years and she's real good at it. She's gonna be competing at the Ben Franklin Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really? My wife loves dance. Nikki loves dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have to talk about me like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just bragging about you. Can't I brag about my little sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk about me in the third person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, gimme a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be nice. Just be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, wow, wow. Fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I don't wanna be mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What meds are you on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? None. I used to be on Lithium and Seroquel and Abilify, but I don't take them anymore, no. They make me foggy and they also make me bloated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was on Xanax and Effexor, but I agree, I wasn't as sharp, so I stopped. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever take Klonopin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klonopin? (Chuckling) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like, "What? What day is it?" How about Trazodone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trazodone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it flattens you out. I mean, you are done. It takes the light right out of your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I bet it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired. I wanna go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, no, no, no. We haven't, we haven't even finished the salad yet, or the duck. I made the Fire and Ice cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'm tired. (to Pat) Are you gonna walk me home or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you. Are you gonna walk me home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have poor social skills. You have a problem. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a problem? You say more inappropriate things than appropriate things. You scare people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell the truth. But you're mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I'm not telling the truth? Veronica and Ronnie are very uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, maybe I should drive them home separately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can drive them both home. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking about me in third person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take Tiffany home first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love it when I have problems. You love it, Von, because then you can be the good one. Just say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... PAT STANDS UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't. I don't. I just wanted to have a nice, I just wanted to have a nice dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your problem?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's my problem! I'm fine. I'm tired and I wanna go. (to Pat) Come on, are you ready? Pat stands. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really, you really wanna go right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I really wanna go! It's been great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, guys, the baby is sleeping!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I don't wanna wake up the baby. Bye. PAT FOLLOWS TIFFANY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, man. PAT GIVES RONNIE AN "ALL GOOD" AND FOLLOWS TIFFANY OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is me. TIFFANY AND PAT STOP, FACE EACH OTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I haven't dated since before my marriage so I don't really remember how this works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How what works?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the way you were looking at me, Pat. You felt it, I felt it, don't lie. We're not liars like they are. I live in the addition around back, which is completely separate from my parents' house, so there's no chance of them walking in on us. I hate the fact that you wore a football jersey to dinner because I hate football, but you can fuck me if you turn the lights off, okay? PAT IS MOMENTARILY SPEECHLESS. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old enough to have a marriage end and not wind up in a mental hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I had a really good time tonight and I think you're really pretty, but I'm married, okay? PAT HOLDS UP HIS HAND, DISPLAYING HIS WEDDING RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're married? So am I. TIFFANY HOLDS UP HER HAND, DISPLAYING HER WEDDING RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's confusing. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what? TIFFANY STARTS TO CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. Hey. TIFFANY PUSHES PAT AWAY AND SLAPS HIM ACROSS THE FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Ronnie called. Hey, is that make-up on your shirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Mom. 50.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: What happened over there? PAT BEELINES PAST PAT SR. TO THE STAIRCASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When am I gonna get a phone? PAT SR. You'll get a phone in due time. (to Dolores) What happened? DOLORES ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat!

dialogues.speaker: PAT REMOVES HIS JERSEY.
dialogues.text: LED ZEPPELIN CONTINUES alternately quiet and LOUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find my wedding video. Mom, wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my wedding video? Led Zeppelin continues. PAT SR. WAKES, LOOKING AT THE ALARM CLOCK. PAT SR. It's after three o'clock! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked in here, but this is all your sewing shit up here, for your sewing and everything. Did you put it up here? PAT STEPS TO AN OPEN CLOSET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about in your father's study?

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: (shouts from bed) Don't go in my study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts O.S.) Dad, not now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you put it in here? It makes no sense for you to put it in here.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: (shouts from bed) Patty, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got all his Eagles videos and not one video of my wedding! PAT SEARCHES THROUGH THE VIDEOTAPES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it here? I mean....? PAT SR. (shouts from bed) Patty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably in the attic.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: (shouts from bed) Are you going in my study?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels to me like you wanna hide my wedding video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop yelling! PAT SEARCHES THROUGH BOXES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not yelling, Mom, I'm just frustrated because I should have my fucking wedding video! 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat! Pat! SHE GOES AFTER HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked over there! I already looked all over there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Pat. PAT TURNS TO FACE HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not calming down! I don't give a fuck who hears, I'm not calming down! Anybody can wake up! I'm not ashamed of it! I'm not ashamed of it! Let the whole neighborhood wake up! I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat! Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...don't care!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop it! Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mom!

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: What's going on? 54.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
