dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Mm-hmm. It's really generous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, being of service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To your need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's start simple. Start at that corner, walk towards me. Walk across the room. Pat stands in the corner, doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we do something else besides the dance deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good with a hammer. You want me to fix something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deal is a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Okay. I was just suggesting that maybe there's a better scenario.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you walk towards me like I'm Nikki. And the only way to convey how much you've missed me is by your walk. By your slow walk. You can't talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only walk. Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No walk, no letter. Walk to me like I'm Nikki, come on. Do it. I'm Nikki. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) You're not Nikki. PAT RELUCTANTLY WALKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look up until you're halfway here. 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. PAT WALKS TO HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Do you feel that? That's emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anybody ever told you how Tommy died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were married for three years and five days, and I loved him. But for the last couple months, I just wasn't into sex at all. It just felt like we were so different and I was depressed. Some of that is just me, some of it was he wanted me to have kids and I have a hard enough time taking care of myself. I don't think that makes me a criminal. Anyway one night after dinner, he drove to Victoria's Secret at King of Prussia Mall and got some lingerie to get something going. And on the way back, he stopped on 76 to help a guy with a flat tire and he got hit by a car and killed. And the Victoria's Secret box was still in the front seat. (pause) That's a feeling. PAT, VISIBLY UPSET, WATCHES AS TIFFANY TURNS TO HER IPOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, this is the waltz. I'm gonna teach you the waltz step.

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY POSITIONS PAT AND GESTURES FOR HIM TO DANCE. HE M
dialogues.text: AROUND HER as she showed him, his hands on his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAT LIES ON BED STARES AT CEILING, emotions churning insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Slow down. PAT STOPS AND TURNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father wanted you to have this. SHE PICKS UP A SECTION OF THE NEWSPAPER AND HANDS IT. HE TAKES THE NEWSPAPER AND LOOKS AT IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants me to have- THROUGH THE DOORWAY, PAT SR. LISTENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -all this Eagles information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, tell Dad thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father expects to spend time with you, Pat. PAT NODS. HE OPENS THE BACK DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Football stays out of this place, so does "Lord of the Flies."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, no, no, no, what are you doing? I'm behind on my syllabus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just throw that outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You're not gonna read that shit on my time. I can tell you all about the "Lord of the Flies." It's a bunch of boys on an island and they have a conch -- they have a shell -- and whoever has the conch has the power and they can talk. And if you don't have the conch, then you don't have the power. And then there's a little chubby boy, and they call him Piggy and they're really mean, and then there's a murder. I mean, humanity is just nasty and there's no silver lining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That was a great synopsis. I still need to read it, though. A KNOCK AT THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that? PAT OPENS THE DOOR. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the....? (laughing) What are you doing here, man? DANNY WALKS INTO THE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If one of your two supervising physicians loses their license, then your whole ajudication is thrown out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know we were here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went by your parents' house looking for you and they told me you was over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, this is Tiffany. (to Tiffany) Tiffany, this is Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Pat told me about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is the girl, that you wrote about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He wrote about me? I'm "the girl"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wrote about you, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said you guys was helping each other out and you were nice and had a mouth on you, that you were mouthy, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, that's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please, tell me more about what he said in the letter. 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, anything you wanna know, I'll just tell you. It was nothing. It was just a very general letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Tiffany) She's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is my friend with an "F."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A capital "F."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For "friend." The three stand there awkwardly for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can I see what you guys are doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. SHE TURNS ON MUSIC: PAT AND TIFFANY DANCE SIDE BY SIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then this goes into something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What is it, what is it, what is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I say something? Do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just say it. Say it. 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Pat, you should be facing Tiffany. DANNY STEPS TO PAT AND TIFFANY, REMOVING HIS JACKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you, Pat, let me show you what I mean. You gotta come at her with a little bit more soul, man. HE HANDS HIS JACKET TO PAT AND FACES TIFFANY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should move more hips. TIFFANY AND DANNY. PAT WATCHES, STANDING BEHIND DANNY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just, just sort of come in, Pat, come in like this. And.... DANNY DANCES, DEMONSTRATING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Can you move `em a little bit more? Yeah, that's it. Move `em a bit more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could turn around, too, there's nothing wrong with that. Yeah. You're pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm, yeah. PAT ENTERS, STEPPING BETWEEN DANNY AND TIFFANY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we got it, we got it. 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. DANNY MOVES, EXITING. AS PAT AND TIFFANY DANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Pat, come on. A little bit more soul. Black it up, Pat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Black it up"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know damn well what it means. TIFFANY LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wait a minute, wait a minute, wait a minute. Oh, man! I got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come get some, Pat. Come get some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuffle back, shuffle back. Shuffle back, shuffle back. Girl, you gotta move your junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get out of here. I gotta go see this girl, Tanya. She lives on this side of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, go see Tanya. Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, man, hey. I'm gonna be there, man. I want you guys to win!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excelsior, Pat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excelsior!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my man. DANNY EXITS. TIFFANY AND PAT SMILE.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: Hey. Patty. PAT WAKES.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pat.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Patty. Where have you been? Huh? PAT GROANS.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We got a serious situation on our hands, you know that. Pat looks concerned, he could be in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We gotta beat the Giants if we wanna have a chance of getting into the division, any chance of playing in the playoffs. Do you realize that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't realize that. 109.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's the bind we're in. I mean, I think it would be wise if we spent father-son time, reading about the Eagles, talking about them, just to strengthen the good luck thing that you're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. PAT SR. Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. PAT SR. Hmm? PAT SR. LOOKS AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just wanted to, maybe I didn't, spend enough time with you growing up. I spent too much time with your brother. It might have made you feel worse about your behavior, but I didn't know anything, I didn't know how to handle it. I mean, that's what all this Eagles stuff is about. It's about us, spending time now. I wanna do everything I can to help you get back on your feet. That's the whole point. Yeah. I wish you'd watch these games with me so we could talk, we could get into things. (inhales) So would you, would you just come downstairs and talk to me and Randy now? PAT SR. TOUCHES PAT'S CHEEK. PAT, MOVED, NODS.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: Randy, tell him what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's betting everything on the Giant game. Everything. 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the money that he needs for the restaurant, he's betting on the Giant game. PAT SR. Tell him why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he believes in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that true? PAT SR. I believe in you, Patty. I believe in you. I want you to know that. So I'm gonna bet heavy on this game. DOLORES STARES INTENSELY AT PAT.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. PAT SR. Heavy. I want you to go to the game with your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to go to the game with Jake? PAT SR. Of course I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he want me to go? PAT SR. Of course he wants you to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told you that? PAT SR. He told me, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even with all his friends? PAT SR. With all his friends. He trusts you. 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not embarrassed? PAT SR. No. I'd love to go to the game, too, but as you know, I'm banned from the stadium. `Cause I'd love to see us beat the Giants and take a lot of money from this asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, personally, I think it's a stupid bet. As a matter of fact, I think it's ridiculous to bet all that dough for the restaurant on a game. PAT SR. Randy. (to Pat) I just hope you heard what I said. It's like a family business, it's our family endeavor. We all stick together on this. That's how it works. That's a positive, positive vibe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a commitment to Tiffany about a project, and we have a very important part of it that we have to go over on Sunday, and it's good for me, Dad. It's making me disciplined and focused, and it's, it's--, I never would've thought this, but it's a good thing. PAT SR. What is this thing you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what is it? What is this project, hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dance thing, okay? There's nothing more to it, Dad. I swear. DOLORES STEPS TO PAT, KISSES HIS FOREHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I need to ask you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow can I spend half the day with you and half the day at the Eagles game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna pretend that you didn't just ask me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the two days that you have promised me and that we have prepared to nail the big move. It's not ready yet. And we don't have a move yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but my dad opened up to me and it was really beautiful and I wanna be of service to him, okay? And he's worried that the juju from the Eagles is being fucked up and he's concerned that it's because I'm spending time with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I messed up the Eagles' juju?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not messing up the juju, but the juju is messed up because I'm not with him during the games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki replied to your letter. TIFFANY STEPS TO THE STAIRCASE, LIFTING AN ENVELOPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't read it until after you nail the big move. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiff, I'm sorry. I can't do anything else without reading Nikki's letter, okay? It's just--, it's in the back of my head. We don't almost have it, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just hope you can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. TIFFANY PICKS UP THE ENVELOPE AND TURNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was her energy when she gave it to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was intrigued, excited, and a little scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was scared? About what? Did she tell you? PAT TAKES THE ENVELOPE. CAMERA TILTS DOWN ONTO HIS HANDS, OPENING THE ENVELOPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to stay positive. PAT'S HANDS UNFOLD THE TYPED LETTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna read it out loud, okay? Because if she says anything that's, you know, is that too much to ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. PAT LOOKS DOWN AT THE LETTER, READING SILENTLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were gonna read it out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dear Pat, It was very emotional for me to get your letter, as I'm sure you can imagine, but I'm glad you took the risk of discreetly getting it to me through Tiffany. This gives us a chance to communicate while I keep the restraining order until I feel safe. I must admit you sound terrific and I'm happy that you are feeling so positive and becoming a more loving and caring man, which I always knew you were. I was moved to read about `Excelsior' and your belief in happy endings. I am also moved by your act of love to read the books I have taught at the high school. I'm sorry you find them so negative, but I disagree. I think they are great works of art that reflect how hard life can be and they can also help kids prepare themselves for the hardness of life. In spite of all these positive developments, Pat, I have to say if it's me reading the signs, I need to see something to prove you are ready to resume our marriage. Otherwise I find myself thinking that we might both be better off moving on with our lives separately. Please don't react quickly to this, but take time to think about it. I'm glad you're doing so well. Love, Nikki." PAT FOLDS UP THE LETTER AGAIN. He is kind of crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm done for today, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (follows him to door) She said to show her something, Pat. This dance can be that something. You would have never done something like this in a million years. It shows all kinds of skills on so many different levels: focus, collaboration, discipline. It's romantic, like I said it would be. It's for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) Thanks for the letter. I'll see you tomorrow, okay? 115.

dialogues.speaker: SCENES SHOWING FOOTBALL FANS ARRIVING.
dialogues.text: PEOPLE (indistinct chatter - continues under following sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I use your phone? PAT SR. Is it an emergency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, kind of. PAT SR. What kind of emergency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm just doing this project with Tiffany and I wanted to tell her I'm not gonna be on time. PAT SR. Just don't make her an emergency, that crazy girl, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not crazy -- I'll just borrow Jake's phone. It's too bad you can't come in to the stadium, but I know you were kicked out, you know, for beating everybody up. Guess we're not that different, huh, Dad? PAT SR. That a bad thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think, it's a good thing. PAT SR. SLOWS THE CAR AND PARKS AT THE CURB. PAT SR. Don't drink too much. Don't hit anybody. You'll be fine. 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `HELLO OPERATOR' BY WHITE STRIPES plays as PAT WALKS, PAS PEOPLE HAVING TAILGATING PARTIES, DRINKING AND EATING. PEOPLE (indistinct chatter - continues under following sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my little brother Pat. JAKE AND PAT, WHO SHAKES HANDS WITH AN O.S. MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Pat, what's this I hear about you just gettin' out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Yeah, from the looney bin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?! I talked to you about that already!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you guys--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? No. JAKE AND PAT. GUY #2 ENTERS, EMBRACING PAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a good dude! He's a good dude. THE GROUP GATHERS AROUND PAT, LIFTING CUPS OF BEER. A HORN HONKS. 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! The Asian invasion!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're here every week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't believe his eyes) No! PAT WALKS, CAMERA MOVING BACK WITH HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Jake you better get your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuckoo bird's takin' off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Patel!

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: Pat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: You know, we must beat the Giants, my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not supposed to be seeing you, right? Outside the office?

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: Pat, Pat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's illegal!

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: Pat, today I'm your brother in green, not your therapist. I'm so happy to see you. How wonderful that you are here! 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jake this is Cliff. This is my doctor, Cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, two things. We gotta watch that bubble screen for fuckin' Manning in the backfield and we gotta make sure we knock the receivers on their ass on the line of scrimmage.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: You can say that again. Those cocksuckers! DR. PATEL, PAT and JAKE LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you know what? I don't have her phone number. If you want, if you really want, you can call Veronica `cause she does, but I don't want to talk to Veronica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you wanna talk to Veronica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she brings me down, man! She just brings me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to change. You're not gonna throw the marriage away. There's some kind of love there. I know, I used to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys have a beautiful thing that got broken somewhere along the line and you gotta fix it like a chiropractor. You gotta give it a chiropractic adjustment. 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough with awkwardness! I don't wanna walk in your house and not be able to say what I wanna say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, man. You're right, you're right, you're right, you're right, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eagles, baby! Yeah! Let's go! THEY LOOK AS THEY WALK TOWARD THE O.S. BUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck? What's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nasty Indian curry! This is America, baby! Go back to your country!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, what's wrong? AN INDIAN MAN SHOVES FAN #1 AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back, Pat. Stay back. FAN #1 PUNCHES ANOTHER INDIAN MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the fucking Indians alone. 120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here, stay here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna go anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get in a fight! JAKE IS SURROUNDED BY FAN #1 AND HIS FRIENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna fight. I'm not gonna fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, not my brother! Hey, hey, hey! CAMERA SWISH PANS ONTO ONE OF THE MEN PUNCHING JAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break it up or you'll be arrested! PAT PUNCHES ONE OF FAN #1'S FRIENDS AND MOVES PAST HIM.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: What'd you do? PAT, JAKE, DR. PATEL AND RONNIE WALK INTO THE ROOM. 121.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad. PAT. DR. PATEL, RONNIE AND JAKE STAND BEHIND HIM. PAT SR. The birds lose, I lose a fuckin' fortune, a fortune to Randy! What the fuck did you do?! You fucking lost it! I thought you said you had it together! You were solid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am solid. I was solid at the game, Dad. I'm solid, I'm solid now. PAT SR. You fell apart! What are you fucking talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: DR. PATEL
dialogues.text: Your son was trying to-- PAT SR. It's all fucking ruined now. It's all ruined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dad! PAT SR. TURNS, REMOVING HIS JERSEY. PAT STEPS TOWARD HIM. PAT SR. AS HE STRUGGLES TO PULL HIS JERSEY OFF. PAT SR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all fucking ruined now! It's all fucking ruined!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dad, Dad, Dad, don't! PAT SR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all ruined, you little fucking shit! 122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dad! I didn't do a fucking thing! Come on, Dad! PAT SR.

dialogues.text: You loser! You loser! PAT SR. SHOVES PAT.

dialogues.text: I'm not a loser. PAT SR. You fucking loser! You ruined everything!

dialogues.text: He was defending his brother!

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: You fucking idiot! You spike the ball on the one yard line, you fucking idiot! THE DOORBELL RINGS. DOLORES LOOKS AT THE FRONT DOOR. THE GROUP WATCHES AS TIFFANY WALKS INTO THE ROOM.

dialogues.text: You think I fucked up the Eagles' juju, don't you? PAT SR. Ever since, ever since he was with you, ever since--

dialogues.text: I'm the reason why today happened? PAT SR. I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk about that. 124.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first night that Pat and I met at my sister's, the Eagles beat the Forty Niners handily, forty to twenty-six. The second time we got together we went for a run and the Phillies beat the Dodgers seven to five in the NLCS.

dialogues.text: She's right, Dad.

dialogues.text: The next time we went for a run the Eagles beat the Falcons, twenty- seven to fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.text: The third time we got together we had Raisin Bran in the diner and the Phillies dominated Tampa Bay in the fourth game of the World Series, ten to two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wow. PAT SR. Let me think about that. Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why don't you think about when the Eagles beat the Seahawks, fourteen to seven. PAT SR. He was with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was with me. We went for a run.

dialogues.text: Really? That's crazy. 125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There have been no games since Pat and I have been rehearsing every day and if Pat had been with me like he was supposed to, he wouldn't have gotten in a fight, he wouldn't be in trouble, maybe the Eagles beat the New York Giants.

dialogues.text: She's making a lot of sense, Pop. That's all right on all counts.

dialogues.text: Does anybody here happen to know what the official motto of the state of New York is on the official seal of the State of New York? Huh? Anybody? (to Pat Sr.) Do you? Do you know? "Excelsior." Look it up. Yeah, "Excelsior."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Pat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Unbelievable.

dialogues.text: That's bullshit! That's not true! Don't say that!

dialogues.text: You get off on it! If not, then prove it. Prove it. PAT SR. Yeah, prove it, prove it!

dialogues.text: How do you want me to prove it? PAT SR. How's he gonna prove it?

dialogues.text: Oh, my God.

I'll give you three more.

dialogues.text: THE LETTER. HE JUST FIGURED SOMETHING OUT: Tiffany wrote letter, not Nikki. 135.

dialogues.text: ...and and a five point four for an average score of..five point zero. DOLORES PUTS A HAND TO HER MOUTH.

dialogues.text: Sorry about that, guys. PAT AND TIFFANY REALIZE -- YES! A FIVE! THEY SCREAM. DANNY, PAT SR., JAKE, DOLORES AND DR. PATEL CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Come on! Pat and Tiffany run to Pat Sr., Dolores, everyone. Pat an his father embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, Dad, did the Eagles win? PAT SR. The Eagles won, forty-four-six! They won, forty- four-six!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are they so excited about a five?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take a ten minute break. PAT EMBRACES DR. PATEL AND DANNY. TIFFANY EMBRACES HER MOTHER AND VERONICA. PAT SLAPS HANDS WITH RONNIE, THEY EMBRACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! You're amazing! PAT PULLS AWAY TIFFANY, WATCHES HIM GO TO NIKKI. 147.

dialogues.speaker: PAT WALKS TO NIKKI. JOHNNY MATHIS
dialogues.text: TIFFANY WATCHES from across the ballroom, emotional as Pa and Nikki talk. At last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you? You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really good. Yeah, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looked really happy out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, who'd have thought, dancing? Tiffany reacts from afar, stung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost a lot of weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been reading your books and, I have a positive attitude. I'm on medication, I'm in therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Tiffany? PAT SR. She left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, she left? PAT SR. She left. What do you think!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? PAT SR. Let me tell you, I know you don't wanna listen to your father, I didn't listen to mine but I'm telling you, you gotta pay attention to the signs. When life reaches out with a moment like this, it's a sin if you don't reach back. I'm telling you, it's a sin if you don't reach back, and it'll haunt you for the rest of your days like a curse. You're facing a big challenge in your life right now, at this very moment, right here. That girl loves you, she really loves you. And I don't know if Nikki ever did, but she sure as hell doesn't love you right now. I'm telling you, don't fuck this up. PAT EMBRACES PAT SR. 149.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Dad. PAT KISSES HIM ON THE CHEEK AND RUNS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY LOOKS OVER HER SHOULDER, TAKES OFF RUNNING. PAT R
dialogues.text: AFTER HER. They turn a corner. He is chasing her, a rever of their previous runs together. HE GRABS HER ARM AND SHE STOPS, TURNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you just leave me alone?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second! HE PULLS A LETTER OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have one more letter for you to read, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is the matter with you? Give it to her yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me say something. You don't ever have to see me again if you just read it, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just read it. TIFFANY UNFOLDS THE LETTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dear Tiffany... SHE STOPS, surprised it is addressed to her. 150.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...I know you wrote the letter. (long pause) The only way you could meet my crazy...."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...was by doing something crazy yourself. Thank you. I love you. I knew it the minute I met you. I'm sorry it took so long for me to catch up. I just got stuck. Pat." I wrote that a week ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wrote that a week ago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let me lie to you for a week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to be romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. SHE LEANS FORWARD AND KISSES HIM, they kiss. Camera pulls away. Score comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world will break your heart ten ways to Sunday, that's guaranteed. And I can't begin to explain that-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -or the craziness inside myself and everybody else, but guess what? Sunday is my favorite day again. I think of everything everyone did for me and I feel like --a very lucky guy.

dialogues.speaker: PAT SR.
dialogues.text: We have to beat the Vikings by three. I'm givin' you a six, which is very generous after the beating you just took. So what are we doin', what are we talkin' about here? PAT SR. TURNS TO RANDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to do another parlay if we make it to the next round, that's all. PAT SR. But we are gonna make it to the next round. We're gonna beat... PAT SR. LEANS DOWN AND PICKS UP A REMOTE CONTROL. JAKE AND RONNIE PLAY CARDS IN THE DINING ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that was me that did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No that was me. 152.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was me. I played the Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you put the bread crumbs, the garlic in the steak and you roll it up with the toothpicks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. For, oh, maybe three hours, plus. PAT SR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's good, everything's good, yeah. I got you, you're all down. (pause) No, Randy, he's complaining. You know he lost a lot of money. He's moaning and groaning. The restaurant's happening because of Randy, so everything's good. TIFFANY SITS DOWN ON PAT'S LAP AND THEY TALK (we cannot h them) and KISS. DOLORES AND DANNY WATCH, SMILING. END CREDITS ROLL UP.
